Posts.Content: Hi Maggie, Im in sunderland . Had my surgery last april, 2 ops. Previous to this I had a core biopsy and a nerve was nipped . It feels as if I am continuously knocking my funny bone and have the numbness and pins and needles associated with it.x
Posts.Title: radiation to axillary

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie. I completed all my treatment in dec and still have stiffness in arm and around mastectomy area. Im having physio to help and do my excercises daily. Im from the northeast too x
Posts.Title: radiation to axillary

Posts.Content: My first appointment to oncologist since finishing treatment and feeling extremely nervous and sick. Trying to keep positive x
Posts.Title: Nevous

Posts.Content: Thankyou everyone. I must have been really nervous as I have just noticed I spelt it wrong. Dreamthief Its just my normal reaction to appointments of the unknown.. Ha ha I had to pay for my coffee. Apart from that all went well. Just regular appointments and awareness from now on and trying to get back to [ normality whatever that is ] quoted the oncologist. I am now going to have a glass of red to celebrate. Thanks again and sweet dreams all x
Posts.Title: Nevous

Posts.Content: I will be thinking of you. Sending my loveÂ  x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy tomorrow, 9-9-15

Posts.Content: Hi Sheryl,yes it is normal to feel as you do. I have grade 2 ductal and seem to have had the exact procedure as you.I finished my treatment last December and returned to work in February but tried to run before I could walk. I know its hard and frustrating but do try and take it at your own pace and ask for help when you need to. Give your body time to adjust as you have been through so much physically and emotionally. I still get tired and angry at times but I suppose its all part of the healing process. Im having a preventative mastectomy next week so will be out of action for a while again and as they say, prevention is better than a cur. o take care and keep strong. Love Jackie x
